title: spack fetch does not work with package@develop installs - that use git/branch URLs
body:
On LCFs where one has to do compiles on backend nodes [which don't have network access] - 'spack fetch' is useful.

However this does not work with git/branch URLs - where a download from the backend is attempted [resulting in build errors]


### Steps to reproduce the issue
Attempting this on a linux workstation - I do see the second download step attempted

```console

balay@pj02:~/spack$ spack fetch adol-c@develop
==> Cloning git repository: https://gitlab.com/adol-c/adol-c.git on branch master
==> No checksum needed when fetching with git
balay@pj02:~/spack$ spack install adol-c@develop
==> autoconf@2.69 : externally installed in /usr
==> autoconf@2.69 : generating module file
==> autoconf@2.69 : registering into DB
==> automake@1.15.1 : externally installed in /usr
==> automake@1.15.1 : generating module file
==> automake@1.15.1 : registering into DB
==> libtool@2.4.6 : externally installed in /usr
==> libtool@2.4.6 : generating module file
==> libtool@2.4.6 : registering into DB
==> m4@1.4.18 : externally installed in /usr
==> m4@1.4.18 : generating module file
==> m4@1.4.18 : registering into DB
==> Installing adol-c
==> Searching for binary cache of adol-c
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for adol-c found: installing from source
==> Cloning git repository: https://gitlab.com/adol-c/adol-c.git on branch master
==> No checksum needed when fetching with git
==> Already staged adol-c-develop-omjty56hedqyctgkyppbd5cgszby3fmv in /home/balay/spack/var/spack/stage/adol-c-develop-omjty56hedqyctgkyppbd5cgszby3fmv
```

### Error Message

Notice the `Cloning git repository: https://gitlab.com/adol-c/adol-c.git on branch master` in the install stage - the fetch should have prevented this.

Is there some option I should use to avoid this second download?

Here is the actual error on one of the LCF runs via scheduler.

Here `spack fetch --dependencies xsdk@develop ^adol-c@develop~examples` was previously run - [but I don't have that log]

And this log is from  `spack install xsdk@develop ^adol-c@develop~examples` [perhaps 10th incremental attempt at installing these collection of packages]

```console
==> Installing pflotran
==> Searching for binary cache of pflotran
==> No binary for pflotran found: installing from source
==> Cloning git repository: https://bitbucket.org/pflotran/pflotran.git
==> Fetching from [git] https://bitbucket.org/pflotran/pflotran.git failed.
Application 12657778 exit codes: 1
Application 12657778 resources: utime ~10699s, stime ~7029s, Rss ~2584700, inblocks ~537582, outblocks ~47712

```

cc: @todd
